item.title: Alex Carey channels AFL pedigree for classic Ashes catch despite Marnus Labuschagne's tackle
item.description: Alex Carey's phenomenal catch late on day one at the Gabba would have been special all on its own, but it was made even more impressive after he had to "out-body" his own teammate.

item.title: South Australian golf course wetland is breeding site for locally extinct tiny native olive perchlet
item.description: Golf courses around the world feature picturesque water ponds as a challenging hazard for players to avoid, but scientists are diving right in. They say golf club wetlands are an ecological safe haven to repopulate threatened native fish.

item.title: Local consortium races to rescue Sanjeev Gupta's Tahmoor mine
item.description: A local consortium is rushing to put forward a bid for the mothballed Tahmoor coal mine, saying it wants the site reopened quickly to protect hundreds of jobs.

item.title: Compressed air energy storage is coming to Broken Hill, but how does it work?
item.description: Broken Hill will be the location of Australia's first large-scale compressed air energy storage system. What is it and how does it work?

item.title: Pentagon's AUKUS review finds areas to put nuclear submarine pact on 'strongest possible footing'
item.description: The review has "identified opportunities to put AUKUS on the strongest possible footing", the Pentagon says. But a congressman who has seen the report says it "fully endorses" the pact.

item.title: Diners and commercial fishers to feel impact of WA demersal fishing ban
item.description: New fishing rules come into effect in Western Australia next month, significantly reducing the amount of local fish available in the state.

item.title: Zak Crawley says Nathan Lyon being dropped for second Ashes Test helped him find rhythm
item.description: Nathan Lyon speaks during an awkward TV interview as Zak Crawley says the spinner's omission helped the English batter find his rhythm.

item.title: Country Hour reporters join listeners to celebrate 80 years of broadcasting
item.description: Outside broadcasts highlight how the Country Hour connects with the daily life of rural Australia.

item.title: Australian red-tipped bananas go viral as social media interest ramps up
item.description: Red-tipped bananas are not new to Australian consumers, but they have gone viral on social media this month after an inquisitive post from two bewildered British backpackers.

item.title: Socceroo Aziz Behich excited that World Cup draw could set up rematch with Argentina
item.description: The Socceroos cannot wait to learn who their opponents will be at the upcoming World Cup, especially if it allows them to handle some unfinished business.

item.title: US military says it killed four men in strike on suspected drug vessel
item.description: The US military says it has killed four men in a strike on a suspected drug vessel in international waters in the Eastern Pacific

item.title: WA miners build up massive gold stockpiles at Perth Mint amid record prices
item.description: WA gold miners are stockpiling millions of dollars worth of the precious metal, believing it is more valuable than cash in the current environment.

item.title: SA Liberal leader Vincent Tarzia steps down from leadership
item.description: South Australian Liberal leader Vincent Tarzia will step down from the leadership, just three months out from the next state election. He told a press conference he made the decision on Friday morning.

item.title: Man from high-profile Victorian family found guilty of rape
item.description: A County Court jury finds a man guilty of two charges of raping a woman in his home after a night of drinking with friends.

item.title: Ayers Rock Resort to be sold to American-owned tourism company
item.description: A deal for the sale of operations at Ayers Rock Resort, near Uluru, and the Mossman Gorge Cultural Centre, in Far North Queensland, is one step closer after the Indigenous Land and Sea Corporation reached an agreement with Journey Beyond, an Australian-based "experiential tourism" company owned by an American private equity firm.

item.title: Bo Popowski receives upgraded charge of murder over death of four-year-old in north-west Tasmania
item.description: Bo Popowski's defence lawyer told the courtroom this was the first time he had heard the word murder used for the case and that he would need time to speak to his client.

item.title: Will a controversial water plan lead to 'bad years' for Roper River barramundi?
item.description: Documents obtained under Freedom of Information laws have revealed planned water extraction from the aquifer that feeds the Northern Territory's Roper River could lead to "bad years" for its fish populations.

item.title: Police search for gunman after shooting at Ballajura candy shop in suburban Perth
item.description: A search is underway for a gunman who fired shots at a store in Perth's north in what police believe was a stand-over tactic by organised crime networks involved in the sale of illegal tobacco.

item.title: Ashes 2025 updates: Australia leads wasteful England by 44 runs on day two at the Gabba
item.description: Will Jacks took a sensational catch, but England dropped five other chances as Australia builds a first innings lead on day two of the second Test Ashes Test at the Gabba.

item.title: Former Western Sydney University student charged over more cyber attacks while on bail
item.description: A former Western Sydney University student already charged with hacking into the institution's servers allegedly continued a campaign against the university by sending more than 109,000 fraudulent emails to students.

item.title: Barwon Coast closes Breamlea track near Geelong after identifying asbestos-containing fragments
item.description: Asbestos has been discovered scattered throughout parts of a coastal town near the Great Ocean Road, prompting land managers to close a section to the public.

item.title: Six native trees poisoned along Noosa's Sunshine Beach
item.description: Six Australian native trees have been poisoned on public land along one of Queensland's most expensive and exclusive beachside streets.

item.title: Israel's continued participation in Eurovision the latest in a string of contentious moments
item.description: Eurovision strives to put pop before politics, but it has repeatedly become embroiled in world events, particularly relating to Israel.

item.title: Families of officers killed in Wieambilla attack launch court action against Queensland and NSW police
item.description: The families of the two officers murdered at Wieambilla in 2022 have made personal injury claims against Queensland and New South Wales police.

item.title: High Court to hear appeal against reduced sentence for teenager who killed Emma Lovell
item.description: Emma Lovell was murdered at her North Lakes home on Boxing Day in 2022 by the then 17-year-old, who was sentenced to 14 years in prison in 2024.

item.title: Jury deliberations begin in trial of Rajwinder Singh, accused of murdering Toyah Cordingley in 2018
item.description: The jury will retire to deliberate on the case of Rajwinder Singh, who is charged with the 2018 murder of Toyah Cordingley, after an almost four-week trial in the Supreme Court in Cairns.

item.title: Man accused of killing passenger in car rollover found not guilty of causing death
item.description: A driver accused of killing a passenger in a car rollover captured by his own dash cam has been found not guilty of causing the death, but guilty of aggravated driving without due care.

item.title: Unlicensed driver hears impact of single-vehicle crash that killed three friends near Tarago
item.description: Nowra man Lachlan Stuckey is facing three charges of dangerous driving occasioning death over a single-vehicle car crash which killed three of his friends near Tarago in July last year.

item.title: Alice Springs sports precinct could showcase Indigenous soccer players, former Manchester United star says
item.description: The Gillen Oval Multi-Sport Precinct has been green-lit and could become a shopwindow for Indigenous soccer players, former Manchester United star and Danish international Jesper Olsen says.

item.title: Chevron invests $3b to continue development of the Gorgon gas project
item.description: The works will connect gas fields in the Greater Gorgon Area to existing infrastructure on Barrow Island.

item.title: Elderly Perth accountant Joseph Papalia jailed for stealing millions from friends, family
item.description: An elderly Perth accountant who stole nearly $10 million from family, friends and former clients is jailed for more than 11 years.

item.title: NSW tourist who hit woman on mobility scooter in WA's south avoids jail
item.description: Paul Vallely has received a fine and had his driver's licence suspended for hitting a woman on a mobility scooter in Albany in September.

item.title: Driver in fatal Daylesford pub crash will face court in bid to avoid giving evidence
item.description: A diabetic man previously charged over a crash that killed five wants to object to giving evidence, on the grounds it may be self-incriminating.

item.title: Friday Finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Ashes 2025: Usman Khawaja's Test future questioned as Travis Head, Jake Weatherald open at Gabba
item.description: After another slashing partnership between openers Travis Head and Jake Weatherald, the future of Usman Khawaja in the Test arena appears to be getting murkier.

item.title: Tasmania Devils could play extra year in existing venues during Macquarie Point stadium construction
item.description: The Tasmania Devils CEO says the club will likely play in the AFL from existing venues for a year longer than expected, while awaiting construction of the Macquarie Point stadium.

item.title: Cary-Hiroyuki Tagawa, actor who performed in Mortal Kombat, has died at 75
item.description: Tagawa died surrounded by his family in Santa Barbara from complications due to a stroke, according to his manager Margie Weiner.

item.title: NZ police recover stolen James Bond-inspired Fabergé pendant after suspect swallowed it
item.description: Police officers were with the suspect around the clock until the stolen pendant was recovered.

item.title: Gocs cameo leaves Smith starstruck, England mourns dropped catches, Weatherald winks — five quick hits from Ashes second Test day two
item.description: Steve Smith is starstruck by a surprise cameo, England rues a slew of drops and Jake Weatherald announces his arrival with a wink. Here are the quick hits from the second day of the pink-ball Ashes Test in Brisbane.

item.title: Jacob Elordi, Nicole Kidman, Alison Brie among the 2026 AACTA nominees
item.description: Apple Cider Vinegar, a partly fictionalised retelling of accused wellness scammer Belle Gibson's public fall from grace, leads this year's AACTA nominations.

item.title: EU hits Elon Musk's X with $210 million fine for breaching bloc's social media law
item.description: European Union regulators say the breaches of the bloc's digital regulations could leave users exposed to scams and manipulation.

item.title: Netflix wins deal to buy Warner Bros's film and TV studio and streaming service for $108bn
item.description: The merger will see beloved shows and movies such as The Big Bang Theory, Game of Thrones and The Wizard of Oz join Netflix’s portfolio.

item.title: Russian manpower challenges Ukraine's technological edge
item.description: When it comes to weaponry, Russia has strength in manpower despite Ukraine's early technological edge while Europe's arms production efforts are running into infrastructure hurdles.

item.title: Porridge back on the menu as budget pressures grow
item.description: How does a treasurer tell households the government will no longer continue a $300 energy rebate when it's happy to blow $100,000 on three flights?

item.title: Today in History, December 6: The day scientists found evidence of water on Mars
item.description: Scientists said at the time that the flow of water would have filled multiple swimming pools.

item.title: Lebanon says it's trying to disarm Hezbollah but fears sparking internal conflict
item.description: Lebanon's government says it is trying to disarm militant group Hezbollah, but there are fears of sparking an internal conflict.

item.title: Senator who backs social media ban says she was a victim of a catfishing attempt in high school
item.description: As the social media ban for teens looms, the parliament's most recent senator reveals she knows firsthand the dangers that can confront young people online.

item.title: Australia delights in a familiar Ashes tale of English woe to take control at the Gabba
item.description: Australia took control of the second Ashes Test at the Gabba on a day that carried plenty of the hallmarks of failed English tours of yesteryear.

item.title: Vladimir Putin offers India 'uninterrupted' fuel supplies at summit in New Delhi with Narendra Modi
item.description: The offer is made at a summit in New Delhi, where new deals on energy, agriculture and labour have also been announced.

item.title: Under deadline, Donald Trump is remaking the White House in his own image
item.description: The US president has spent much of his first year back in office changing the historic building he fought to reclaim in a bid to cement his legacy.

item.title: It's been a tumultuous time for SA's Liberals — they now need to find another new leader
item.description: SA Liberal leader Vincent Tarzia has stepped down. Pressure had been mounting in the lead-up to the 2026 state election, and predictions for the Liberal Party's chances are not looking promising.

item.title: First-aid advice for venomous bites and stings at your fingertips with new app
item.description: As a new app is launched to provide first-aid advice for venomous bites and stings, a reptile expert urges people to learn how to respond in an emergency ahead of an expected spike in demand for antivenom over summer.

item.title: Drone vision shows devastation across North Sumatra after landslides and floods.

item.title: BNPB supply drop to remote village in North Sumatra
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Efforts turn to helping survivors and recovering the dead after devastating floods in Indonesia
item.description: Landslides across Sumatra in Indonesia have cut off roads and destroyed homes, creating several pockets of isolated villages where a helicopter is the only way in.

item.title: Sexism, harassment and inflexibility drive women out of winemaking, survey reveals
item.description: Among the main factors contributing to women leaving Australia's wine industry were sexism, discrimination, and a lack of flexibility, a nationwide study has found.

item.title: Australian Christmas in full bloom as flora and fauna burst with colour
item.description: As the summer heat settles in, flora and fauna associated with Christmas in Australia can be spotted throughout the country.

item.title: State Theatre's new name speaks to the philanthropy predicament in the arts
item.description: No sensible organisation can now afford to turn down money or its requirements. So, cash-strapped institutions find themselves between a rock and a hard place with a big name painted on it.

item.title: Brisbane community radio station 4ZZZ celebrates 50 years against all odds
item.description: Brisbane community radio station 4ZZZ has withstood political, social and financial pressure for 50 years and it's still thriving as a loud and proud beacon of counterculture.

item.title: Young people urged to join stem cell donor roll with full matches hard to come by
item.description: Rowan Tong-Law, 18, was diagnosed with acute myeloid leukaemia last year and has been searching for a full stem cell donor match.

item.title: Woman's two-year journey advocating for Auslan support highlights cracks in aged care system
item.description: One Deaf woman living with dementia has been without basic care services for two years. Advocates warn her story represents a much larger problem.

item.title: When will construction begin on the new Hobart stadium?
item.description: That and other questions answered now that the $1.13 billion stadium project has passed Tasmania's parliament.

item.title: Coronial inquest investigates Terry Airey's death at Sunshine Coast University Hospital
item.description: A Queensland hospital has increased staffing and revamped its radiology protocols and systems following an 87-year-old's death from organ failure after routine surgery.

item.title: Life on the APY Lands where family, country and culture are protected
item.description: The stark beauty of Australia's protected APY Lands is alive with ancient songlines and culture. But Elders see a need for change to secure the future of today's children.

item.title: Frank Gehry, world-renowned architect who designed the Guggenheim Museum Bilbao, dies aged 96
item.description: Gehry's most memorable creations were either celebrated as works of genius or reviled as self-indulgent messes — but either way, people were looking, as he liked to say.

item.title: Blue whale calf numbers rise after slow migration start along WA's south west coast
item.description: Researchers are relieved as baby blue whale numbers increase after a slow start to the migration season.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: This tasty, veggie-filled omlette is a fast and satisfying meal - ABC News
item.description: Ejjeh is a traditional omelette made with eggs, herbs, spices and that soft zucchini flesh that would otherwise go to waste. It's simple, fresh and full of flavour.

item.title: Roger Cook wants to change the rules on project approvals to avoid FOMO, but critics have their doubts
item.description: The WA premier is seeking wide-reaching powers to change the rules on approvals for "big, shiny, job-creating projects" — but it has prompted concern from the opposition, environmentalists and even lawyers.

item.title: Asbestos found in new Edith Cowan University campus in Perth CBD
item.description: WA's parliament is told asbestos has been discovered in fire doors at Edith Cowan University's flagship new campus in Perth's CBD, and it won't be removed until after the first semester next year.

item.title: The National Indigenous Art Triennial in Canberra reflects on legacy, rebirth and renewal
item.description: Indigenous artists from across Australia, including Alair Pambegan and Grace Kemarre Robinya, feature as part of the National Indigenous Art Triennial in Canberra: After the Rain.

item.title: Adelaide residents 'in the dark' over Gilbert Street development proposal
item.description: Residents of Gilbert Street who originally opposed a development proposal say a deal was struck behind closed doors to proceed with planning.

item.title: Bunbury Indigenous elders write children's book in Noongar language to preserve culture
item.description: Once forbidden from speaking their local language, a group of Indigenous elders in WA use it in a children's book, hoping to breathe life into a dying dialect.

item.title: Interest rate hikes increasingly likely in 2026 but a major event would produce the opposite result
item.description: Inflation is a problem as 2025 comes to a close and it's set to remain that way. Without a swift rise in productivity or a financial markets meltdown, borrowers are facing several interest rate hikes next year.

item.title: Controversial genetically modified mosquito release paused after backlash in Qld
item.description: An organisation that planned to sell "friendly" mosquitoes to reduce the spread of diseases like dengue withdraws its licence application after backlash from scientists and health experts.

item.title: Malaysian football in chaos after FIFA suspends national players from Argentina, Spain and Brazil
item.description: A football players' union says seven South American and European members of the Malaysian national team suspended over allegedly forged documents are "victims".

item.title: Socceroos far from a World Cup 'group of death' against United States, Paraguay and a European qualifier
item.description: Nothing can be guaranteed in a World Cup, but the Socceroos' draw alongside the United States, Paraguay and a European qualifier gives a solid shot at advancing, with the Australians avoiding most of the big names.

item.title: 2025 US National Security Strategy warns Europe faces 'civilisational erasure', does not mention AUKUS
item.description: The Trump administration releases a document saying its goal is to "help Europe correct its current trajectory", adding that it faces "civilisational erasure" due in part to "mass migration".

item.title: Ashes 2025 updates: Mitchell Starc's all-round brilliance puts Australia on the verge of 2-0 series lead
item.description: Mitchell Starc and Scott Boland torment England with both bat and ball as Australia puts itself on the verge of claiming a 2-0 series lead in Brisbane.

item.title: Whale researchers in Timor-Leste are calling for regulation of the whale watching industry following reports of operators piloting boats too close to mammals.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: The gold toilet, the bags of cash and the corruption still stalking Ukraine
item.description: Ukraine has a history of corruption issues, but the latest allegations include close confidants of the president and many people want answers from Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

item.title: Critics choice nominations 2026: Sinners scores 17 nods, One Battle After Another earns 14
item.description: The gothic vampire period drama Sinners has topped the Critics' Choice Movie Awards, securing 17 nods, followed by One Battle After Another with 14.

item.title: Queensland government to pump $200 million into racing facilities under long-awaited industry plan
item.description: The Next Lap plan will establish a $200 million infrastructure fund, streamline governance, and maintain taxation levels, and comes about two months after an independent review into the sector.

item.title: Teen seriously injured in e-bike crash in Claremont after e-rideables inquiry called for widespread changes
item.description: A 14-year-old boy suffers serious injuries in an e-bike crash in Perth's western suburbs, just two days after a parliamentary inquiry into WA's e-rideable laws made 33 recommendations in a bid to make the devices safer.

item.title: Not all babies need a hepatitis B shot at birth, US vaccine advisers say
item.description: President Donald Trump is calling the vote a "very good decision" after US vaccine advisers recommended ending the universal hepatitis B shots at birth.

item.title: Overnight fire exchange at Afghan-Pakistan border kills five and wounds eight, officials say
item.description: Each side has blamed the other for triggering the clash in violation of a tenuous two-month ceasefire, with the clashes lasting until dawn Saturday.

item.title: Archer's English pillow, Starc's top score and a couple of firsts for England — quick hits from day three of the Gabba Ashes Test
item.description: A sleepy Jofra Archer cops a rinsing from Matthew Hayden, as the English finally make it through the first over of an innings. Here are the quick hits from day three of the Gabba Ashes Test.

item.title: Opposition to social media ban scores minor political points at best
item.description: Australia's social media age ban is one of the most significant attempts to rebalance the asymmetric power relationship between government and tech.

item.title: Politicians in South-East Asia ignore climate change at their own political peril
item.description: Accused of incompetence and apathy in the aftermath of natural disasters, governments across Asia are facing increasing backlash as the impact of global warming intensifies.

item.title: Hard Quiz: So, you think you're good at quizzes? It's time to play HARD!
item.description: Alright, show us what you've got. I'll keep my expectations low.

item.title: How pregnancy is being criminalised in post-Roe America
item.description: In the wake of widespread abortion bans, US prosecutors launch hundreds of cases charging people with crimes related to their pregnancy, miscarriage, stillbirth or birth.

item.title: Gearing up for the school holidays? Here's how to survive them without social media
item.description: These school holidays, children under 16 will find themselves with less social media access as a ban comes into place. We asked the experts how parents can best support their kids with the transition.

item.title: What life's like when you're Deaf and blind
item.description: Living with vision impairment throws up many challenges. Being Deaf on top of that requires you to go to even greater lengths just to fit in with the modern world. This is how one Deafblind woman does it.

item.title: Rare piece of Australia's Indigenous history captured on camera in the desert
item.description: In the 1960s, the last of the desert families were coming into contact with white people. For one woman, the moment was captured on camera.

item.title: Russia's claim it has captured key Ukrainian city could be Putin 'scaremongering'
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin this week claimed Moscow's biggest battlefield gain in close to two years: the Ukrainian city of Pokrovsk. Some experts don't believe him.

item.title: Republicans just won an election in Tennessee but it's still bad news for Trump
item.description: A Republican claimed a win at a by-election in Tennessee this week, but his party colleagues are sounding alarm bells.

item.title: Australia senses Ashes kill as England and Bazball face day of reckoning at the Gabba
item.description: Australia was patient, mature and ruthless on day three at the Gabba, widening the chasm between it and an England side now set for its day of reckoning.

item.title: Reedy Creek Reserve's Paperbark Forest Walk in Agnes Water closed after tourist and environment concerns
item.description: Bush Heritage Australia says it is still considering how to safely reopen the walk, which prior to closure was being visited by 100,000 people a year.

item.title: Melbourne council responds to lunch-thieving seagulls knocking food from pedestrians' hands
item.description: Pesky seagulls snatching food from unsuspecting members of the public has spurred a Melbourne council to start canine patrols of Federation Square.

item.title: 'Less algal influence' seen in some SA waters, divers say
item.description: Open water divers say underwater visibility has improved and marine life is returning to some areas off South Australia's coast. Experts say it's a positive sign, but warn it's "way too early" to say the environment is recovering from the state's algal bloom.

item.title: Number of homes destroyed in NSW bushfires rises to at least 20 as recovery efforts begin
item.description: Natural disasters are declared in six areas across NSW, as the number of homes destroyed rises to at least 20, with the majority concentrated on the Central Coast.

item.title: Palestinians in West Bank's Bethlehem hold first Christmas tree lighting ceremony since 2022
item.description: As the ceasefire in Gaza enters its second month, the Palestinian city revered by Christians as the birthplace of Jesus holds a ceremony to light up a 20-metre tree at the edge of Manger Square.

item.title: Criminals are trying new methods to get drugs into Australia but authorities say they are always watching
item.description: The alleged use of an international livestock ship to smuggle drugs into Western Australia last month prompted a media storm, but one expert says it is just one among a "dizzying variety" of methods criminals are trying.

item.title: Water leaks, electric shocks force 32yo breast cancer unit off road in Tasmania
item.description: Tasmania's health department was aware a 32-year-old breast cancer screening bus was unsafe for years, but continued operating it up until two staff suffered electric shocks.

item.title: Insurance doctor never spoke to traumatised former NSW Police officer before challenging his mental health
item.description: A former NSW Police officer with post-traumatic stress disorder had his mental health incorrectly challenged by a doctor who never consulted or examined him during a year-long battle with the force's insurer.

item.title: Parents urged to learn the rules about e-mobility devices as Christmas approaches
item.description: An e-bike will be top of their Christmas wish list this year, prompting a warning for parents to know the rules.

item.title: Michael Neser takes two key England wickets with caught-and-bowleds as Australia in Ashes command
item.description: Bowling all-rounder Michael Neser is back and taking vital wickets after beginning to think he had played his last Test match for Australia.

item.title: QVMAG costs Launceston ratepayers millions of dollars every year, but there are fears reform has hit a wall
item.description: More than three years after a Tasmanian council green-lit a plan to ease the financial burden of the Queen Victoria Museum and Art Gallery, stakeholders worry momentum has stalled.

item.title: Aged care in Australia under the microscope in new documentary Careless
item.description: Filmmaker Sue Thomson recently lost her mum. But before that, they made the beautiful documentary Careless together, which explores Australia's aged care system mess.

item.title: Western Australia's Port Hedland marks 50th anniversary of Cyclone Joan
item.description: Cyclone Joan made landfall near the WA mining town of Port Hedland a year after Cyclone Tracy flattened Darwin, and it was almost as powerful.

item.title: Russian drone, missile attacks target Ukrainian railways and power infrastructure in overnight barrage
item.description: A large-scale Russian drone and missile attack damages power facilities in eight Ukrainian regions, causing blackouts and forcing nuclear power plants to cut output.

item.title: Fire jumps a kilometre over water, disaster declared for NSW regions — as it happened
item.description: NSW Premier Chris Minns says it has been a "difficult 24 hours", with more than 20 fires still uncontained across the state.

item.title: Researchers are teaching foxes not to eat freshwater turtle eggs, by making them feel sick
item.description: Researchers in Victoria are using taste aversion conditioning to stop foxes eating native turtle eggs.

item.title: Questions raised about Gavin Morris's suitability as Yipirinya School principal after conviction
item.description: Former Yipirinya School principal Gavin Morris has been found guilty of aggravated assault against students, but questions have been raised about Morris's hiring and his suitability for the role.

item.title: Socceroos FIFA World Cup 2026 times, dates and locations set, with games in Vancouver, Seattle and Santa Clara
item.description: Australia's North American west coast adventure at the World Cup is confirmed, with matches in Vancouver, Seattle and Santa Clara in California.

item.title: Australia's new land clearing, regrowth laws spark concern among farmers
item.description: Queensland producers say a blanket approach to environmental laws will restrict their ability to manage land sustainably and responsibly.

item.title: Prime minister's office approved Anika Wells's almost-$100,000 flights
item.description: The furore over Communications Minister Anika Wells's expenses continues, with just three days until the government's much-anticipated social media ban for under 16s comes into force.

item.title: Iconic Lagoon restaurant lease ends after 40 colourful and controversial years
item.description: For four decades Lagoon Restaurant has been one of Wollongong's most iconic and controversial establishments, enjoying a prime seaside location and a close relationship with the city's political class.

item.title: Surf Life Saving WA brings all-abilities nippers program to regions for the first time
item.description: Catering to children with autism spectrum disorders, it is the first of its kind in regional Western Australia.

item.title: Cleveland Dodd inquest findings expected to unpack dysfunction in WA's youth justice system
item.description: The coroner investigating WA’s first recorded death in youth detention is expected to hand down wide-ranging findings and recommendations following the death of 16-year-old Cleveland Dodd in 2022. Here's everything you need to know.

item.title: Perth Scorchers book WBBL finals spot with seven-wicket win over winless Brisbane Heat at the WACA
item.description: Beth Mooney's flawless 94 not out leads Perth to victory in its must-win game against Brisbane, ensuring the Scorchers will play finals again in the WBBL.

item.title: At least 11 killed in South Africa hostel shooting
item.description: Gunmen stormed a hostel in the early hours of the morning, shooting 25 people at the scene and killing at least 11 people, including three children.

item.title: Child of Stolen Generations in WA given her birth certificate after 88 years
item.description: Maisie Harkin was born on country in Western Australia's Great Victoria Desert. It has taken 88 years for her birth to be officially recognised.

item.title: Firefighters battle blaze in Redhead, Lake Macquarie
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Four arrested after food thrown at Crown Jewels display case
item.description: An organisation called Take Back Power, which describes itself as a civil resistance group, posted footage of the incident on social media and said two of its members had smothered the Imperial State Crown display case with apple crumble and custard.

item.title: Concerns for the future of Canberra's public pools amid closures and redevelopments
item.description: As temperatures soar, advocates of public pools in Canberra say they want to see greater support and investment for facilities in the national capital.

item.title: Ashes 2025 updates: Steve Smith and Jofra Archer in fiery clash as Australia wins second Test against England
item.description: Australian captain Steve Smith lets his bat do the talking following a fiery exchange with Jofra Archer in an eight-wicket win in the second Test in Brisbane.

item.title: The $108 billion Warner Bros and Netflix deal has sparked backlash — here's why
item.description: A major deal between Netflix and Warner Bros has sent shock waves through Hollywood and sparked backlash.

item.title: Ashton Hurn to run for SA Liberal leadership following Tarzia departure
item.description: South Australian Liberal frontbencher Ashton Hurn will run for her party's leadership, following the shock resignation of Vincent Tarzia just months out from the next state election.

item.title: Unpause and rewind: Cassette tapes are making a comeback
item.description: For a supposedly obsolete music format, audio cassette sales seem to be set on fast forward at the moment.

item.title: South Australian distillers tap into trending thirst for limoncello
item.description: South Australian distillers are tapping into a growing global thirst for limoncello and finding a new market for lemons and grape spirit.

item.title: Tasmania Fire Service confirms 19 homes destroyed and nearly 200 assets damaged in Dolphin Sands bushfire
item.description: The Tasmania Fire Service confirms 19 homes have been claimed by a bushfire that ripped through Dolphin Sands this week, while nearly 200 assets have been damaged.

item.title: Sydney Sixers sneak home in final-ball thriller against Adelaide Strikers to secure WBBL finals spot
item.description: Ellyse Perry produced one of the best knocks of her career but the Sydney Sixers took until the final ball to see off the Adelaide Strikers and land a WBBL finals spot.

item.title: Albanese defends Anika Wells' weekend in Thredbo
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Firefighters attend to smouldering homes in Koolewong, NSW
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Locals to be consulted on plan for a new Alice Springs library after council announces location
item.description: The location for the new Alice Springs Public Library was announced late last month, with residents soon able to have their say on what they want included in the $20 million facility.

item.title: Cameron Smith denied first Australian Open title as Rasmus Neergaard-Petersen claims win
item.description: A missed putt costs Cameron Smith the chance of winning his first Australian Open, as Denmark's Rasmus Neergaard-Petersen claimed a thrilling one-stroke victory at Royal Melbourne.

item.title: Teenager charged after passenger killed in early morning crash at Corio
item.description: A 16-year-old boy is alleged to have been the driver of a car which crashed into a pole early Sunday, killing a 17-year-old passenger.

item.title: Record number of temporary residents in Australia - 7 December 2025
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Yatala prisoner hospitalised after being 'brutally bashed', union says
item.description: A 20-year-old prisoner was so badly bashed at an Adelaide jail on Sunday morning that he was left "barely recognisable" and had to be rushed to hospital for treatment, a union says.

item.title: Man smashes ambulance windscreen with head in Kalgoorlie-Boulder
item.description: A video circulated on social media shows a naked male using his head to smash the windscreen of a moving ambulance.

item.title: Japan and Australia urge calm after Chinese radar locks onto Japanese jets
item.description: Japan formally protests the incident, calling it "an extremely regrettable" and dangerous act that "exceeded the scope necessary for safe aircraft operations".

item.title: Smith fires up, Bazball leaves the building and a miraculous grab — quick hits from day four of the Gabba Ashes Test
item.description: Smith "champs" Archer, Bazball leaves the building and the Australian captain breaks the game open with a miraculous grab. Here are the quick hits from the fourth and final day of the Gabba Ashes Test.

item.title: F1 Abu Dhabi: Lando Norris wins world title, Max Verstappen wins Abu Dhabi Grand Prix, Oscar Piastri second
item.description: Max Verstappen has won the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix ahead of Oscar Piastri, but Lando Norris finishes third to claim the world title.

item.title: Ben Stokes questions England's ability to handle Ashes pressure as Brendon McCullum warns of 'glass jaw'
item.description: England's famed captain-coach duo aren't going to let their relationship fray in the face of the biggest test of their polarising tenure.

item.title: This week in history quiz, December 8: Can you best our test?
item.description: From the world's first traffic lights to a Sesame Street legend — how well will you do on our history quiz?

item.title: Is it ever OK to leave a party or social event without saying goodbye?
item.description: We asked two experts for their advice on the etiquette of leaving a social gathering without notice and the best approaches to take if you do need to depart suddenly.

item.title: Australia and Steve Smith chase total Ashes domination as England pokes the bear in Brisbane
item.description: The snarl on Steve Smith's face proves conclusively that Australia doesn't just want to beat the English in this Ashes series. It wants to break them.

item.title: Have you been involved in a multi-level marketing business? Tell us your MLM story
item.description: Multi-level marketing networks have been around for decades. But their business models are changing, with consumer advocates warning that the industry is rife with predatory tactics. We want to hear about your experiences with MLMs.

item.title: Australian MLM influencers are cashing in on the manosphere
item.description: A global multi-level-marketing business that sells expensive water ionisers is shifting its target audience to Aussie tradies, but critics say some of their predatory sales tactics are tantamount to a pyramid scheme.

item.title: Devastated families grapple with ferocity of NSW Central Coast bushfires
item.description: Residents on the NSW coast are coming to terms with property loss after bushfires swept through the region on Saturday.

item.title: How Europe is gearing up to follow Australia's teen social media ban
item.description: The European Union says it will learn from Australia's new laws to bar under-16s from social media, with steps to implement the world-first ban already underway and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen praising Australia's "brave move".

item.title: Communities harness the people power of co-ops to stave off privatisation
item.description: For its passionate members, saving a historic goldrush-era pub to protect their cooperative was about "economic democracy" and keeping the property out of developers' hands.

item.title: First-home buyers on government's MyHome scheme struggling to get sellers on board
item.description: When Regan buys his first home, the government will own around 30 per cent of it. But he is fast realising that for that to even happen, a lot of things have to fall into place.

item.title: Russia increases recruitment of foreign fighters through targeted social media campaigns
item.description: Through a targeted social media campaign, Russia is offering citizenship and money to foreigners who join its fight in Ukraine, but experts say it is a desperate measure.

item.title: China's global technology and engineering ascendancy continues
item.description: China used to be trying to catch the West, specifically the US. Then it caught up. Now the West is trying to catch up to China, but likely can't.

item.title: Exploitation fears over SA government aged care changes
item.description: The South Australian government is trying to speed up the transfer of hospital patients into aged care, but advocates say they are "trampling on the rights of older people" in the process.

item.title: Anika Wells's taxpayer-funded Thredbo ski trip a costly distraction for Labor
item.description: What was meant to be a Sunday interview bookending a remarkable political year became an exercise in explaining the inexplicable.

item.title: Crops preferred to sheep in large parts of Australia's traditional mixed farming regions
item.description: Mixed farming, which involves growing crops and rearing livestock, used to be standard practice in Australia, but there are almost 100 million fewer sheep in Australia than there were 35 years ago.

item.title: Muster Dogs favourite Frank Finger makes final on-screen appearance with kelpie Annie in portrait show
item.description: From hit series Muster Dogs to a new television show, Frank Finger and his beloved kelpie Annie's unbreakable bond steals the spotlight once again.

item.title: Damaged buildings in Darayya, Syria, one year after the civil war ended
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: A year after the fall of Bashar Al-Assad, Syrians are scraping by
item.description: Today marks one year since the Assad dictatorship in Syria was toppled by Islamist rebels, bringing an end to nearly 14 years of civil war. Some are celebrating, while others continue to struggle.

item.title: Health regulator accused of failing to support patients amid complaints over doctors' conduct
item.description: Two women have told the ABC they believe the health regulator is failing to acknowledge the power imbalance between doctors and patients.

item.title: Where Oscar Piastri lost the Formula 1 world championship, McLaren teammate Lando Norris claims ultimate prize
item.description: Oscar Piastri missed out on winning the Formula 1 drivers world championship by just 13 points to his teammate Lando Norris, the culmination of multiple small moments throughout the season that cost him dearly.

item.title: Hotline claims to have identified more than 200 alleged historical child abuse offenders in secretive Christian sect
item.description: Jillian Hishon has devoted hundreds of hours, listening to an estimated 280 victims of historical child sexual abuse from within the fundamentalist Christian church she grew up in.

item.title: Oscar Piastri praised as future formula 1 world champion by rivals
item.description: Oscar Piastri's chief rival, new formula 1 world champion Lando Norris, says the Australian will "get the better of me" after their tension-filled title race decider in Abu Dhabi.

item.title: The US fired on survivors clinging to a 'drug boat' — who gave the order?
item.description: What happened in the lead-up to a second strike on a speedboat in the Caribbean — who knew what and when, and who gave what order — is now under scrutiny.

item.title: Interstate clerical abuse survivors reflect on horrors and remember lives lost to suicide
item.description: Newcastle and Ballarat are 1,100 kilometres apart but share a dark bond — scores of suicide deaths linked to historical Catholic clergy abuse.

item.title: Markets live updates: ASX slips ahead of RBA decision, miners sold off, National Storage agrees to $4 billion takeover
item.description: Expectations of a rate cut pushed Wall Street higher, but the ASX has failed to follow the positive lead, falling as the RBA meeting gets underway. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Murray-Darling Basin predicted to be hotter and drier by 2050 if nothing changes
item.description: Water needs for river communities will be under increasing pressure over the next 25 years, according to predictions from the Murray-Darling Basin Authority.

item.title: 59yo NPWS firefighter killed by falling tree during bushfire prevention work at Nerong
item.description: A National Parks and Wildlife Service firefighter dies after being crushed by a tree during bushfire prevention work north of Newcastle.

item.title: Federal politics live: Barnaby Joyce joins One Nation, weeks after leaving Nationals
item.description: Former deputy prime minister Barnaby Joyce has joined One Nation after leaving the Nationals. Follow live.

item.title: Rory McIlroy did not win Australian Open but still completed one of his missions
item.description: Rory McIlroy's appearance at the Australian Open in Melbourne has gone a long way to restoring the prestige of the tournament.

item.title: New NT training program aims to attract and keep home tutors at remote stations
item.description: A course offered for the first time this year has upskilled home tutors working on remote central Australian cattle stations in a bid to ease education workforce shortages in the outback.

item.title: WA economic regulator accuses power generators of overcharging utilities for wholesale electricity
item.description: The cost of electricity is being driven up by some Western Australian power producers breaking the rules and charging more than they're allowed, the state's economic watchdog alleges.

item.title: Hitchhiking Pilbara mechanic Kevin Guiness recounts a lifetime on the road
item.description: At 12 years old, Kevin Guiness was rebuilding engines on an outback cattle station. Now, after decades travelling the dusty roads in the Pilbara, the Yindjibarndi elder reflects on what kept him going.

item.title: How the internet reacted to Australia winning the second Ashes Test
item.description: Mitchell Starc was the hero, again, as the English were comprehensively outplayed in Brisbane — but how did the internet react?

item.title: Brendon McCullum says England 'over-prepared' ahead of Brisbane Test, as players head to Noosa
item.description: England coach Brendon McCullum claims his team trained too hard for the Gabba Test, which ended in a bruising eight-wicket loss that leaves the tourists' Ashes hopes in tatters.

item.title: Donald Trump Jr says there is little appetite for the US to fund the Ukrainian war effort.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Kremlin praises Donald Trump's national security strategy
item.description: The strategy argues the US should revive the 19th century Monroe Doctrine, which declared the Western hemisphere to be Washington's zone of influence.

item.title: 'Everything destroyed' as Indonesia's Aceh grapples with disease after floods
item.description: Hit by deadly floods, Indonesians in the region around Aceh Tamiang are grappling with worsening diseases and a lack of medical care at the lone hospital in the area.

item.title: City of Rockingham residents complain of maggots and flies after FOGO introduction
item.description: Perth residents say they are dealing with an "infestation of maggots" and stinking rubbish after the introduction of a third bin for food and garden waste. But the local council is adamant it will not be making any changes.

item.title: Jessica Stenson breaks Australian women's marathon record during Valencia race
item.description: Jessica Stenson breaks the Australian marathon record before an emotional phone call to the former record holder, Sinead Diver.

item.title: How would your feed look if you got to control what you saw on social media?
item.description: Sexual violence prevention group Teach Us Consent is pushing for Australians to have the choice to "opt-in" to social media algorithms.

item.title: Notorious paedophile Ashley Paul Griffith could have been 'detected and disrupted earlier', damning review finds
item.description: The Queensland government in January ordered a review into how one of the country's most notorious paedophiles was able to offend for so long.

item.title: Ashton Hurn confirmed as SA Liberal leader months out from March election
item.description: South Australian Liberal MP Ashton Hurn has secured her party's leadership months out from the next state election.

item.title: Benin President Patrice Talon says coup attempt thwarted with help from Nigerian military
item.description: Patrice Talon says the West African nation's government will punish those responsible for a coup attempt.

item.title: Attorney-General Deb Frecklington said the review found Griffith "could have been stopped and should have been stopped".
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: South Australians prisons in lockdown as staff hold 24-hour 'stop-work'
item.description: All South Australian prisons are in lockdown a day after a prisoner was allegedly assaulted, but the Department for Correctional Services says the industrial action was pre-planned.

item.title: Cleveland Dodd's care in Unit 18 'inhumane', coroner examining youth detention death finds
item.description: Western Australia's first recorded death in youth detention was predictable, a coroner finds, declaring the care of 16-year-old Cleveland Dodd was "inhumane" and "reminiscent of 19th century jails". WARNING: This story contains the name and image of an Indigenous person who has died.

item.title: Water leak at the Louvre museum damages hundreds of works
item.description: The leak occurred after a valve was accidentally opened in a heating and ventilation system, allowing water to seep through the ceiling of the Mollien wing.

item.title: Pedestrian killed, woman seriously injured as car crashes into Melbourne medical centre
item.description: Police are investigating the death of a male pedestrian after a car crashed into a building in Niddrie, in Melbourne's west, with a 63-year-old driver taken to hospital under police guard.

item.title: Barnaby Joyce joins One Nation, concluding defection from Nationals
item.description: Barnaby Joyce's defection gives One Nation its first lower house seat since 1998.

item.title: England's lack of Ashes depth highlighted as Australia A thumps Lions at Allan Border Field
item.description: England's lack of Test depth is highlighted as Australia A beats the Lions by an innings and 127 runs.

item.title: Government will not extend energy bill relief
item.description: Jim Chalmers says the end to the "temporary" subsidy was a "hard" decision but recognises pressures on the budget.

item.title: Thailand launches air strikes amid new border clashes with Cambodia
item.description: Thailand launches air strikes along its disputed border with Cambodia, after both countries accuse one another of breaching a ceasefire agreement brokered by US President Donald Trump.

item.title: Men jailed for gang raping women at Newcastle bucks weekend have convictions quashed
item.description: Marius Hawell, his brother and a friend have had their convictions thrown out on grounds of appeal, after being handed jail sentences of between nine and 14 years.

item.title: One of PNG's rare conjoined twins dies after urgent surgery in Sydney, brother survives
item.description: Surgeons have separated a rare set of conjoined twins after they were urgently airlifted from Papua New Guinea to Australia, but only one of the boys has survived.

item.title: Police charge 18-year-old man allegedly involved in fatal Ascot Vale stabbing
item.description: Police charge an 18-year-old man with offences including intentionally causing injury and affray, following the incident that claimed the life of a 40-year-old in Ascot Vale on Sunday afternoon.
